subject: Sexual Health
title: Age and Female Fertility
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Age and Female Fertility.

hook.text: Female fertility peaks in the early twenties and begins a gradual decline that accelerates after 35.

buildup.text: At 30, a healthy woman has about a 20% chance per cycle. By 40, it drops to about 5%.

discovery.text: The decline is driven by both fewer remaining eggs and a higher percentage with chromosomal errors.

twist.text: Lifestyle cannot stop the biological clock, but healthy habits can support the best possible egg quality.

climax.text: Awareness of age-related fertility decline empowers women to plan proactively rather than reactively.

punchline.text: Biology sets the clock. Knowledge gives you options.
